strings:
<center>‘The youngest of the seven sages was Egeus,
<center>the Holy Child. A prophet at just six
<center>years old, he first sensed the threat of
<center>the Lord of Darkness.

<center>‘Another was Regnar,
<center>who returned from the after[-]life.
<center>He knew the Goddess better than any other,
<center>and it was he who named the Godbird Empyrea.

<center>‘Then there was Kadan, the great scholar.
<center>His wisdom was second to none,
<center>and it was said that he knew all
<center>there was to know in this wide world.

<center>‘Another was Golding, the warrior.
<center>His might was without equal,
<center>and friends and foes alike claimed
<center>that Fortune rode with him into battle.

<center>‘Then there was Alexander,
<center>the magical swords[-]man.
<center>His prodigious skills extended far beyond the
<center>battlefield, as he was also a talented sculptor.

<center>‘Another was Master Gozo, the sorcerer.
<center>To him ancient tomes of magic unclasped
<center>their secrets, granting the use of their
<center>most potent spells.
<center>‘And finally there was I, Kupas, the magician.

<center>‘Together, we used our lives as the key to lock
<center>the Lord of Darkness's soul inside the sceptre.

<center>‘As long as our descendants live on,
<center>Rhapthorne's body and soul can never
<center>escape from their prisons.

<center>‘The Lord of Darkness's body is sealed within
<center>a large rock in the centre of the world.

<center>‘I have been told that Alexander turned
<center>the rock into a statue to prevent
<center>unwary men from interfering with it.’
